step_1_context.text: I have been studying for three hours, so I need a short break.

step_2_explanation.simple_rule: Use present perfect continuous for actions that started in the past and continue now, or just stopped with visible result.
step_2_explanation.common_mistake: Use for with duration and since with starting point.

step_3_interactive_exercises.question: Choose the correct sentence.
options: She has been work here since 2020.
She has been working here since 2020.
She is been working here since 2020.
step_3_interactive_exercises.correct_answer: She has been working here since 2020.

step_3_interactive_exercises.incorrect_sentence: I have been waiting since two hours.
step_3_interactive_exercises.corrected_sentence: I have been waiting for two hours.
step_3_interactive_exercises.error_analysis: Use for with a duration (two hours), since with a starting point (2 p.m.).
